abstract: Calpine, the bankrupt power generator, said it had reached a preliminary settlement with a group of bondholders that would eliminate a large group of duplicate claims filed in its bankruptcy case. The settlement, which requires United States bankruptcy court approval, will reduce $12 billion in claims tied to bonds in a Calpine unit to a single claim of $3.5 billion, the company said. Calpine, based in San Jose, Calif., also said it would seek approval from HSBC Bank, the indenture trustee on the bonds.
